mdRecord.dcterms:title: A soldier is my beau
Oh a soldier is my beau I would have you know
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St., N.Y.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in three verses and 2 choruses; without music. Printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: "Oh! a soldier is my beau, I would have you to know."
"The music of this highly popular song can be had at John J. Daly's music shop, 419 Grand Street, New York. Sung with great applause by Miss Fannie Denham." -- Follows caption title.
With advertisement "Ten [i]llustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 Cents."
Hand-colored headpiece featuring Cavalry and Artillery maneuveurs. Magnus 124. Cf. American song sheets, 2139c.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: E647 .S63 no.18: Boxed with other Civil War song sheets.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: M1628.3 .C6 1861 no.13: Thirteenth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Soldiers--United States--Songs and music--Texts
